column3: Just asking, what happens when not using it during build of libsecp256k1? Are you using own routines for doing what libgmp was used for?\n

@Diapolo indeed. GMP can be used for getting a faster modular inverse implementation, or for implementing field arithmetic (operations modulo p = 2^256 - 2^32 - 977), while there are other implementations for both too.\n
@diapolo yes, and note that libgmp is not used for any routines that version 0.10 actually uses from secp256k1 (ie, signing), so it was a useless dependency\n
@laanwj Just wanted to verify that this wasn't supposed to be merged into master also?\n
This should end up in master through a normal secp256k1 update, see @sipa's other pulls.\nE.g. #5506 may have it.\n
@laanwj @sipa https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/5506 does not have it, just FYI\n
